derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: possibly from earlier alewife 'woman who keeps an ale house', with reference to the fish's large belly

means.word_mean: 1. flesh of shad-like fish abundant along the Atlantic coast or in coastal streams
2. shad-like food fish that runs rivers to spawn; often salted or smoked; sometimes placed in genus Pomolobus

auth_sentence.content: They were introduced into the Great Lakes a long time ago to control a trash fish, the alewife.
